Key Match Events: Cyprus won 0-4 against Kosovo with goals from Tzionis (37'), Pittas (62')
Pre-Game Insights: Cyprus welcome Kosovo to Larnaca in League C Group 2 of the UEFA Nations League on Monday on the back of an impressive win on matchday one.
Kosovo need to respond after a humbling defeat in Pristina against Romania.
Cyprus boss Temuri Ketsbaia silenced his critics with a fine win away in Lithuania on Friday evening.
Kosovo have already had their promotion hopes dashed by a bruising 3-0 defeat at home to Romania on matchday one.
Kosovo will come into this clash as favourites, but they could be in for a frustrating evening against a rejuvenated Cyprus side.
Post-Match Reflections: Kosovo's manager Franco Foda will be looking for an instant response from his team after a poor first competitive fixture.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cyprus have been handed a very difficult section considering it is a third-tier group.
Kosovo have had great difficulty in recent years at performing when being the favourites to win, especially in Euro 2024 qualifying.
Others: Cyprus only took five points from their six UNL games in 2022, avoiding the relegation playoff despite finishing bottom of their group, but they are already 60% of the way to matching that tally after just one game this time around.
Kosovo have been struggling with complacency against weaker sides, and that must be avoided here if they want to keep Romania in their sights.
